organizations: Getty Images Dan Reynolds of Imagine Dragons

thread.title: Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, The Weeknd lead AMAs nominees
thread.title_full: Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, The Weeknd lead AMAs nominees

title: Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, The Weeknd lead AMAs nominees
text: Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, The Weeknd lead AMAs nominees Add six American Music Awards nominations to Taylor Swift's mountain of accomplishments this calendar year. Post to Facebook Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, The Weeknd lead AMAs nominees Add six American Music Awards nominations to Taylor Swift's mountain of accomplishments this calendar year. Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1REZvFh Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, The Weeknd lead AMAs nominees Maeve McDermott, USA TODAY 11:57 a.m. EDT October 13, 2015 Taylor Swift opened the 2014 American Music Awards at the Nokia Theatre in Los Angeles at Nov. 23, 2014, performing 'Blank Space.' Matt Sayles, Matt Sayles/Invision/AP Taylor Swift refers to her 'Blank Space' video for the AMAs' opening number. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Charli XCX starts her performance off sweetly with 'Boom Clap.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Charli XCX performs 'Break the Rules.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Luke Hemmings of 5 Seconds of Summer jumps into the band's performance. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Nasri of Magic! and Wyclef Jean perform 'Rude.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Annalise Bishop Foxx and Jamie Foxx speak onstage, before presenting the award for favorite rap/hip-hop album to Iggy Azalea. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Iggy Azalea and her mentor T.I. appear onstage as she accepts the award for best rap/hip-hop album. "This is the first award I've ever won in my entire life," she said. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Dan Reynolds of Imagine Dragons performs the band's new single, 'I Bet My Life.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Iggy Azalea begins her performance with 'Fancy.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Sam Smith accepts the Favorite Pop/Rock Male Artist award. Kevin Winter, Getty Images A$AP Rocky hits the stage to rap alongside Sam Smith, who won the Favorite Male Pop/Rock Artist award. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Luke Bryan accepts the Favorite Country Male Artist award. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Lorde dances it out to her 'Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1' theme song 'Yellow Flicker Beat.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Ariana Grande performs, starting off with a piano-accompanied medley of hits like 'Problem' and 'Break Free.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Ne-Yo and host Pitbull break it down during their joint performance. Kevin Winter, Getty Images A somber Selena Gomez performs her new song 'The Heart Wants What It Wants' (reportedly about Justin Bieber). Kevin Winter, Getty Images Skylar Grey hit the piano to sing the hook for Nicki Minaj's new song 'Bed of Lies.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Christina Milian teamed up with Lil Wayne. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Fergie sings her new single 'L.A.LOVE.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Diana Ross presents the first-ever Dick Clark Award for Excellence to Taylor Swift, who praised the icon for paving the way for smart women in music. Kevin Winter, Getty Images As she accepts the Dick Clark Award for Excellence, Taylor Swift thanks her fans, who she says value albums and the idea that music has value as art. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Mary J. Blige performs her new song 'Therapy,' co-penned by AMA winner Sam Smith. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Host Pitbull chats it up with BFFs Lorde, Taylor Swift and model Karlie Kloss during the show. Jeff Kravitz/AMA2014, FilmMagic Jessie J, Nicki Minaj and Ariana Grande belt (and rap) their way through a golden rendition of 'Bang Bang.' Kevin Winter, Getty Images Fullscreen Niall Horan, Harry Styles, Liam Payne, Zayn Malik and Louis Tomlinson of One Direction accept the Artist of the Year award. The boy band took home three out of three honors for which it was nominated, including the night's top prize. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Jennifer Lopez (here) and Iggy Azalea brought their 'Booty' to the AMAs, performing to close the show. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Jennifer Lopez closes out the show. Kevin Winter, Getty Images Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
